SEARCH
Package de.fherfurt.clevercash.api.controller

Klasse SavingController

java.lang.Object
de.fherfurt.clevercash.api.controller.SavingController
@RestController @RequestMapping(path="/api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts/{bankAccountID}/savings") public class SavingController extends Object
Controller class for managing operations related to savings associated with bank accounts. Provides endpoints for creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting savings. Handles HTTP requests and interacts with the SavingService to perform operations on savings. Ensures that access control is enforced using AuthenticationService.

Endpoints available in this controller:

  • GET /api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts/{bankAccountID}/savings - Retrieve a list of savings with optional filters.
  • GET /api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts/{bankAccountID}/savings/{savingID} - Retrieve a specific saving by its ID.
  • POST /api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts/{bankAccountID}/savings - Add a new saving to a bank account.
  • DELETE /api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts/{bankAccountID}/savings/{savingID} - Remove a specific saving from a bank account.
  • GET /api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts/{bankAccountID}/savings/activeSaving - Retrieve the active saving for a bank account.
  • DELETE /api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts/{bankAccountID}/savings/activeSaving - Remove the active saving from a bank account.
  • PUT /api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts/{bankAccountID}/savings/credit - Credit a certain amount back to the account and deduct it from the savings.

Handles exceptions and returns appropriate HTTP status codes and error messages for various error conditions:

  • 400 Bad Request - When request parameters or body are invalid.
  • 403 Forbidden - When the user does not have the required permissions.
  • 404 Not Found - When the requested resource (user, bank account, or saving) is not found.
  • 409 Conflict - When there is a conflict, such as an existing saving with the same name.
Autor:
Richard Prax, Jakob Roch

  • Methodendetails

    • findSavings

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<?>> findSavings(@PathVariable int userID, @PathVariable int bankAccountID, @RequestParam(required=false) String startDate, @RequestParam(required=false) String endDate, @RequestParam(required=false) String description, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Retrieves savings for a specific user and bank account with optional filters.
      Parameter:
      userID - the ID of the user whose savings are to be retrieved
      bankAccountID - the ID of the bank account to filter savings for
      startDate - optional start date of the period to filter savings (inclusive), in the format yyyy-MM-dd
      endDate - optional end date of the period to filter savings (inclusive), in the format yyyy-MM-dd
      description - optional substring to filter savings by their description
      Gibt zurück:
      a ResponseEntity containing the list of filtered savings, or an appropriate error status if an exception occurs

    • findSavingByID

      @GetMapping("/{savingID}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> findSavingByID(@PathVariable int userID, @PathVariable int bankAccountID, @PathVariable int savingID, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Retrieves a specific saving associated with the specified user, bank account, and saving ID.
      Parameter:
      userID - the ID of the user
      bankAccountID - the ID of the bank account
      savingID - the ID of the saving to retrieve
      Gibt zurück:
      a ResponseEntity containing the saving if found, or an appropriate error status if not found

    • addSavingToBankAccount

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addSavingToBankAccount(@PathVariable int userID, @PathVariable int bankAccountID, @RequestBody NewSavingDTO newSavingDTO, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Adds a saving to a specific bank account associated with the specified user.
      Parameter:
      userID - the ID of the user
      bankAccountID - the ID of the bank account to add the saving to
      newSavingDTO - the saving to be added
      Gibt zurück:
      a ResponseEntity containing the updated bank account with the added saving if successful, or an appropriate error status if the operation fails

    • removeSavingFromBankAccount

      @DeleteMapping(path="/{savingID}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> removeSavingFromBankAccount(@PathVariable int userID, @PathVariable int bankAccountID, @PathVariable int savingID, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Removes a saving from a specific bank account associated with the specified user.
      Parameter:
      userID - the ID of the user
      bankAccountID - the ID of the bank account
      savingID - the ID of the saving to remove
      Gibt zurück:
      a ResponseEntity containing the updated bank account with the removed saving if successful, or an appropriate error status if the saving is not found

    • findActiveSaving

      @GetMapping(path="/activeSaving") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> findActiveSaving(@PathVariable int userID, @PathVariable int bankAccountID, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Retrieves the active saving associated with the specified user and bank account.
      Parameter:
      userID - the ID of the user
      bankAccountID - the ID of the bank account
      Gibt zurück:
      a ResponseEntity containing the active saving if found, or an appropriate error status if not found

    • removeActiveSaving

      @DeleteMapping(path="/activeSaving") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> removeActiveSaving(@PathVariable int userID, @PathVariable int bankAccountID, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Removes the active saving from a specific bank account associated with the specified user.
      Parameter:
      userID - the ID of the user
      bankAccountID - the ID of the bank account
      Gibt zurück:
      a ResponseEntity containing a success message if the active saving is removed successfully, or an appropriate error status if the saving is not found or if there is no active saving to remove

    • transferFromSavingToBalance

      @PutMapping(path="/credit") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> transferFromSavingToBalance(@PathVariable int userID, @PathVariable int bankAccountID, @RequestParam int amountInt, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Credits a certain amount back to the account and deducts it from the savings amount.
      Parameter:
      userID - the ID of the user
      bankAccountID - the ID of the bank account
      amountInt - the amount to be credited
      Gibt zurück:
      a ResponseEntity containing the updated bank account if successful, or an appropriate error status if the operation fails
